title: QIC, Schiphol win Hobart Airport auction, buy 70pc stake
text:
Australian infrastructure investor QIC Ltd and Dutch partner Schiphol have agreed a deal to acquire a 70 per cent stake in Hobart Airport, sources told Street Talk on Tuesday.

It is understood the pair won an auction to buy Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets' 50.1 per cent, and have agreed a deal to acquire another 19.9 per cent from Tasmanian superannuation fund Tasplan.

While the price is not known, sources said the deal valued the airport at 25-times to 26-times earnings, which would indicate a fair price given it is the only majority stake in a capital city airport to come to market in recent times.

QIC and Schiphol are new major shareholders in Hobart Airport. Michael Bunn

Hobart Airport has also been a beneficiary of strong traffic growth in recent years with both Qantas Airways and Virgin Australia putting on additional routes to capitalise on growing tourism interest in Tasmania.

It comes after a hotly contested auction that came to a head last week when Credit Suisse collected bids for MIRA's 50.1 per cent stake.
description: Australian infrastructure investor QIC Ltd and Dutch partner Schiphol have agreed a deal to acquire a 70 per cent stake in Hobart Airport, sources told Street Talk on Tuesday.
